meanings.definition: To board a vehicle or vessel again.
meanings.sent1: After the quick stop, the passengers will reboard the bus.
meanings.sent2: The passengers had to reboard the train after the delay.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful traveler had to reboard the plane to retrieve their luggage.
meanings.sent4: As the storm passed, the crew could finally reboard the ship and continue their journey.
meanings.sent5: The group had to reboard the ferry quickly before it departed without them.

meanings.definition: To return to a board or committee.
meanings.sent1: The retired member decided to reboard the committee to offer their expertise.
meanings.sent2: She was excited to reboard the board of directors after her leave of absence.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would reboard the committee just for the free snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to reboard the committee was met with applause and support.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to reboard the board of trustees was unexpected but welcomed.

meanings.definition: To get back on board a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: Passengers were asked to reboard the plane after the maintenance issue was resolved.
meanings.sent2: The crew quickly reboarded the ship to prepare for departure.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous traveler had to reboard the cruise ship after a thrilling shore excursion.
meanings.sent4: The pilot announced that it was safe to reboard the aircraft after the weather cleared.
meanings.sent5: The passengers eagerly awaited the signal to reboard the luxury yacht for the evening cruise.
